column4: I'm having problums installing UBUNTU.  I've tried installing Breazy, Dapper, and the current version.
If I try to install the newest version, I get an error that says "/bin/sh can't access tty; job control disabled"
If I try to install Dapper, it tells me that it cannot mount the CD.  Even though its already loaded and running.
If I try and install Breazy it installs to the point where it asks me to configure my user account and then all it does is ask me over and over agian and will not progress any further.

Can somebody help me get one of these versions installed?  I'd like to end up with Dapper if possible.  Also please read the whole issue as I keep having people only read part of it and then spend time trying to help me fix the wrong issue for the wrong install.
don't mess with breezy, out of date
it has nothing tod o with helping/not helping.. but alot of breezy repos are closed, if you manage to get it installed, you'll be pissed off when you can't install anything.
what type of media are you using?
: TO burn the CD?  Memorex CD-R.
hmm. never a problem with Memorex DVDRs
I do not have a DVD Burner
i asked becuse sometimes using DVD/CD RW's causes problems
: But i'm not using DVD media
i didn't yell, you're not listening.
No you asked me what I was using then said you had no problums with DVD media.  THen got pissed at me because I simply tried to say I did not have that option.
the alternate install CD is a text based install.
